subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4 with bea 9.2 workshop
msgSnippet: ... If you get too embarrassed by the riches, you can stay with JUnit and have what I assume is the equivalent of @AfterSuite:
messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
> On 8/10/06, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:
>
>> sethmalm wrote:
>>
>>
>>> Is it possible to use Junit 4 with BEA Workshop? If not, how can I
>>> have a tear down method that runs only once at the end of a test.
>>>
>> I can only answer the second part of your question, although I imagine
>> the answer to the first part of your question is "yes, why not?"
>>
>> I assume you want a tear down method that runs once at the end of a test
>> /suite/, meaning all the tests in a test class. If that is indeed what
>> you want, then use @AfterClass instead of @After. There is also the
>> corresponding @BeforeClass for @Before.
>>
>
>
> And if this doesn't suffice, I'll just point out that TestNG also supports
> @AfterSuite, @AfterTest and @AfterGroups. A real embarrassment of riches.
>
> And if it's not enough, please let us know what you need and I'll do my best
> to convince you that you don't need it :-)
>

If you get too embarrassed by the riches, you can stay with JUnit and
have what I assume is the equivalent of @AfterSuite:

http://shareandenjoy.saff.net/2006/08/beforeclass-and-afterclass-on-suites.html

David Saff
